case_vignette: A 20-YEAR-OLD MALE WITH A MEDICAL HISTORY OF DIABETES MELLITUS TYPE 1 PRESENTS WITH ECCHYMOSIS AND BULLOUS LESIONS ON HIS BACK, POSTERIOR LEGS, AND BUTTOCKS. HE WAS PLAYING FOOTBALL WHEN HE RAN INTO ANOTHER PLAYER AND BECAME UNCONSCIOUS. HE WAS IMMOBILE IN THE HOSPITAL FOR 3 DAYS BEFORE HE REGAINED CONSCIOUSNESS. HE HAS ABOUT 7 TENSE BLISTERS WITH AREAS OF SURROUNDING ERYTHEMA ON THE BACK, BUTTOCKS, AND POSTERIOR THIGHS.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have bruises and tense blister-like lesions on my back, buttocks, and the back of my thighs.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms since I was hospitalized three days ago after a football injury.
Have you been confined to bed rest since your hospitalization?
Yes, I was immobile in the hospital for 3 days.
Are the blister-like lesions painful or itchy?
The blister-like lesions are surrounded by redness.
Do you have any underlying health conditions or are you taking any medication currently?
I have Type 1 Diabetes.
Final Diagnosis: Pressure ulcers

I have bruises and blister-like bumps on my back, legs, and buttocks.

Were you prescribed any medication after your visit to the hospital?
